Currently, calls relating to custom date fields in JIRA can cause performance issues as it needs to make a query for each issue.  Being able to set the timeout for JIRA Calendar only would provide a workaround for customers experiencing this issue.

Note the system timeout feature would need to be able to be set in Cloud environments.

fields.description:
I think it is important to allow our client to be able to view stats on the server to allow them to see if they need to report any system issues. 

We have add-on's such as JavaMelody which allows the user to view what is happening. 

The goal of JavaMelody is to monitor Java or Java EE application servers in QA and production environments. It is not a tool to simulate requests from users, it is a tool to measure and calculate statistics on real operation of an application depending on the usage of the application by users. JavaMelody is mainly based on statistics of requests and on evolution charts.

* https://code.google.com/p/javamelody/wiki/AtlassianPlugin

* http://demo.javamelody.cloudbees.net/monitoring

Also it would be nice if our Apache logs were configured like: 
{code}
LogFormat "%h %l %u %t \"%r\" %>s %b \"%{Referer}i\" \"%{User-Agent}i\" **%T/%D**" combined
{code}
fields.summary: Allow system monitoring to be view able.

fields.description:
When receiving email notifications for comments or inline comments in Confluence OnDemand, the email message does not currently distinguish between either type.

e.g. "xxx commented on a page" could be inline or at the bottom of the page.

It would be help to distinguish between them - e.g.

"commented inline on a page" vs "commented on a page"

This might sound minor, but the notification may be recalled later by the user who then navigates to the page, rather than clicking on the link. By distinguishing between inline and page comments in the original notification, this may give a clue to the user about where to look for the comment or inline comment when browsing the page or once an inline comment is resolved.
fields.summary: Email alerts for inline comments should indicate they are "inline"

fields.description:
1. Browse to /admin for an instance (checked & confirmed on master in Horde, and dev & dog) and change the signup settings to allow some type of open signup.
2. Click Save (or Update, can't remember what the button is called)
Observed: "successfully updated" message appears, but signup settings flick back to off
Expected: "successfully updated" message appears, signup settings stay set to whatever you set them to
More info: the back-end resources are persisting & returning the correct info; looks like the front-end just isn't parsing it properly.

h4.Workaround
Check to the *alert admin* option and have unchecked to create users, and save. Will be updated in database to off. You'll need to do a hard browser refresh to see the option removed from login screen.

fields.description:
We have JIRA on-demand at work, and I use it for my personal work. The problem with it is that there are far too many email notifications sent. JIRA sends a notification for every single change applied to an issue, and usually every interaction with an issue results in two or three changes (sprint, assignee, priority, etc.).

Will Atlassian ever add fine-grained control of the types of notifications? I basically only ever want to know a) when a new bug is assigned to me, and b) if someone explicitly mentions me in a comment.

I tried searching for a similar issue to this, but didn't find this particular complaint. Thanks!
fields.summary: JIRA sends too many email notifications

but I don't think it is enough.

Since there are 2 pages ([Importing Issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Importing+Issues] and [Importing Users|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Importing+Users]) in the same hierarchy, customers may mistakenly think "JIRA Import" explained in [Importing Issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Importing+Issues] imports only issues but not users/groups.

fields.description:
I've verified this in 3 scrum boards.

The Plan mode is returning the wrong tickets or no tickets at all. I verified the filter query can still see open tickets, but open tickets do not show up on the boards. Instead, we see closed/resolved tickets.

Given that we also noticed that the NOT logic was broken this morning (AOD-7607), I verified that we are not using NOT logic in these filter queries. One of them is quite simply:

"labels = LabelHere ORDER BY Rank ASC"

In the issue results it shows 36 open tickets, in the Plan Mode window it shows only the closed tickets.

We found this out while trying to plan and start a new sprint, this is blocking completion of some work that carried over form the last sprint as we cannot close it outside of a sprint without breaking statistics and such.
fields.summary: Agile Plan Mode is returning the wrong (Closed, resolved) tickets and not displaying open tickets

fields.description:
We have an issue filter that jst recently began returning bad results...  It appears that, in this filter, the results of the "AND NOT" criteria are returning the same results as if we simply used "AND"

Example:

project = "PL Application"  AND NOT (issuetype = bug AND priority = Low) AND Status != Closed

produces same results as

project = "PL Application"  AND (issuetype = bug AND priority = Low) AND Status != Closed
fields.summary: AND NOT functionality in Jira filters now returns same results as AND

fields.description:
h3.Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a dummy JIRA Admin account.
# Access the user management. 
# Check the application access.

h3.Expected Results:
System Administrator should not be included in the application access. 

h3.Actual Results:
System Administrator *is counted* in the application access. If the System Administrator fills up the last application access slot. This will prevent the customer from creating new users as well.

h3.Workaround:
No workaround to fix the bug but if user is having difficulties creating new users due to the bug (and application access limit); Sysadmins can create the new users on their behalf.

h3.Note
-It seems the the extra count (contributed by the System Administrator) is mostly visual. It doesn't actually add to the application access. Meaning it doesn't actually upgrade the billing tier even though it might look like the quantity is breached.-

h3.Update
*Seems like this bug actually consumes the license count (but it doesn't trigger billing tier upgrade)*. If customer has maximum users of 25  and due to the bug they are seeing 25 out of 25 users; they will not be able to create new users due to insufficient application access. However if the system administrator sees 24 out of 25 users (not affected by the bug); they can add the new user in.
fields.summary: System Administrator being counted in Application Access

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 25 NOV 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi Everyone,

Recently, the atlassian.net domain has been classified incorrectly as "High Risk" by a third party security website - http://www.brightcloud.com/tools/url-ip-lookup.php.

Any firewall system using BrightCloud security services is potentially affected by this issue - http://www.brightcloud.com.

Our security team has escalated this directly to the team at webroot, as this has been identified as a false positive. As a workaround, you will need to manually open up access through your firewall system to the atlassian.net domain, while the team at webroot is investigating and updating their systems.

There is no current timetable from the webroot team for resolution. We would also recommend you contact webroot (http://www.brightcloud.com/about/contactus.php), or your vendor to alert them to this issue.

We will continue to update you on the status of this issue as new information is obtained.

Feel free to contact support with any questions or concerns at https://support.atlassian.com.

Atlassian OnDemand Team
{panel}
fields.summary: Unable to access OnDemand instance due to false positive for malware attack

A permissão nos projetos está igual, e um desses lideres está com permissão de ver o time dele no tempo e incluir Grace period. Eu preciso de dar essa permissão para os outros lideres, porém quando comparo as permissões não há diferença.
fields.summary: Permissão nos projetos com visualização diferente
Don't know how to get started. Everything is not obvious.

fields.description:
As stated in [Atlassian Cloud Storage Policy documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Atlassian+Cloud+storage+policy], the disk limit for Atlassian Cloud is set as 25GB for every instance.

Although this may be enough for small instances, which a few users, large instances with more users require more disk space, specially because there will be more users to create content.

As a customer, as I update my user tier, I would like to be entitled to more disk space.
fields.summary: Allow more disk space for instances with more users
Add Malay

fields.description:
We currently use Okta for Single Sign On here at Rocket Fuel. Does JIRA OnDemand support SAML 2.0? If so, how do I go about setting this up on our instance?

If you do not support this, are there any workarounds to accomplish this?
fields.summary: SAML 2.0 for JIRA OnDemand

fields.description:
*Symptoms*

Accessing Atlassian Cloud Applications from a Windows Server 2003 installation results in SSL Certificate errors. This behaviour can happen either when performing API calls or trying to access JIRA from a browser.

*Cause*

Recently the Root Certificates used on our Cloud environment were upgraded to use the SHA384RSA signature algorithm, and that algorithm is not supported natively by Windows Server 2003.

*Resolution*

Microsoft has released a Hotfix which adds support to that signature algorithm. Installing that Hotfix on the Server should fix the issue for all customers. Hotfix can be found on the following page on the Microsoft website: http://support2.microsoft.com/kb/938397

This information can also be found on the following Knowledge Base Article: [Accessing Atlassian Cloud Applications from a Windows Server 2003 Installation Results in SSL Certificate Errors|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ONDEMANDKB/Accessing+Atlassian+Cloud+Applications+from+a+Windows+Server+2003+Installation+Results+in+SSL+Certificate+Errors]
fields.summary: Accessing Atlassian Cloud Applications from a Windows Server 2003 Installation Results in SSL Certificate Errors

fields.description:
see https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/jst/problem-report-109015

When creating a new project,  a new Issue Type Scheme and a new Workflow Scheme are also created.  *This should not happen as _ALL_ it does is add unnecessary work for the administrator*.

A new project is either going to get an already existing scheme, or it's going to need a new one crafted by the administrator.  It's not going to need a new plain default scheme. So creating new plain schemes doesn't provide any benefit.

All it does is add two "delete scheme" cleanup tasks that have to be done every time a new project is created.  It's either that or the administrator decides not to delete them and watches as a vast number of identical Issue Type and Workflow schemes are created (a *maintenance nightmare*).

A new project is automatically assigned the already-existing Default Permission Scheme.
It's automatically assigned the already-existing Default Notifications scheme.
And the already-existing Default Issue Type Screen scheme.
And the Default Field Configuration.
*So why does it have to get a new Issue Type and Workflow schemes. Why can't it just be assigned the defaults for those?*

Up until a week ago, the JIRA Classic project type enabled an administrator to create a project without these extra unneeded schemes being created.  But, in it's [ongoing effort|https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/jst/user-management-88542] to [make things more difficult|https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/jst/problem-report-110057] for administrators Atlassian decided it was a good idea to [remove the JIRA Classic project type|https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/jst/problem-report-109015] (while falsely claiming ["This project type was duplicated by the Project Management project type"|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/15+September+2014+to+19+September+2014]).

{color:red}*Bring back the JIRA CLassic project type or at least provide some project type that doesn't create more work for administrators.*{color}
fields.summary: Creating new project also creates unneeded, unnecessary, UNWANTED schemes and workflows

fields.description:
Currently the CA certificate store available in the production cloud platform does not play nicely with newer CAs. Specifically the one utilized by [Springloops|http://www.springloops.io/] (GlobalSign Root CA). This causes customers to be unable to connect to that git repo as a source for bamboo.

{code}[jirastudio-prd][root@djeholdings:/data/jirastudio/webdav/test_git]# git clone https://slsapp.com/git/toolbelt/test-286.git
Cloning into 'test-286'...
error: SSL certificate problem, verify that the CA cert is OK. Details:
error:14090086:SSL routines:SSL3_GET_SERVER_CERTIFICATE:certificate verify failed while accessing https://slsapp.com/git/toolbelt/test-286.git/info/refs
fatal: HTTP request failed
{code}
fields.summary: Current ondemand production environment does not support Springloops cert

so to delete a service desk user whose profile was automatically; Lets say a user created 50 new accounts there should be a way to remove the user or combine the users name to a company.
